topic.title: How to set no proxy for value TOR 9.5.x
topic.body:
Hello,

Can someone please explain how to set the 'no proxy for' value in TOR v9.5.3 or offer instructions to enable access to ZeroNet via the TOR browser please?

Clean install of ZeroNet 0.7.1 and TOR 9.5.3 32bit running on WIN10 Pro 64bit.

For anyone else looking for the answer in the TOR address bar type 'about:config' then search for 'network.proxy.no_proxies_on' then enter 127.0.0.1 as the value.

topic.title: Would a fusion of inrupt and ZeroNet be worth thinking about?
topic.body:
I'm not a developer/coder beyond some poking about 'n cut & paste, so I have no idea if this would be worthy of consideration or not?

Would it be possible to combine something like the https://inrupt.com UI and Services with the  ZeroNet platform?

The issue with Inrupt is the cloud hosted pod and single sign-on concept. 

I haven't really given it much thought, but Inrupt seems like a pretty useful with some good features. Having a cloud based pod with a single sign-on has obvious drawbacks, with respect to privacy/anonymity etc. It is also reliant on clearnet service such as dns etc.

Inrupt on the ZeroNet platform seems like an appealing concept to me from a user/content creator perspective.

Crazy idea or worthy of more thought?

1602918342_1BKJiQF8pvdQw99D1XpTG2UJ6eno1.body:
binary makes some good points but neglected to mention some major factors such as the markets are rigged and manipulated. No matter how smart you are unless you're an insider or top man in a major fund you will never have the edge.

Stay well clear of any derivatives markets because that is nothing short of a Ponzi scheme the likes of which has never been seen before. When that bubble finally bursts the markets will crash 'n burn imho. No one even knows the real value of the derivatives exposure. 

It would probably be a much smarter move to invest in tangible physical assets which have a real world value. Physical precious metals are an option, but you can think outside the box and go for commodities like high end Whisky for example. The problem is the cost/access to secure storage, especially for a container load of Whisky etc. If property is affordable then buying commercial property or a domestic property with a secure barn or two wculd also be an investment.

Buying a property with a few acres that can sustain basic crop and livestock production should be first on the list, as an investment, as a home and a means to sustain ones self and family.

Investments in expanding your personal knowledge and piratical skills would also be a wise decision imho.

Investing in your local community is also something to consider. If your neighbors and community are strong everyone benefits in the long term.

Pick investments which have as little interaction with authorities and governments as possible. Much easier said than done unfortunately.

Invest in your health and wellbeing; spiritually, mentally and physically. Spiritually doesn't mean following an organised region,  bible or faith. Imho it means establishing your own understanding of the reality you live in, based on knowledge from as many different sources as you can find. It can be very time consuming, but knowing where and who you are allows you to make much better life choices in all asespects of your life.

I doubt that much of that is anything like the advice you're looking for or expecting. Hopefully you will give some of it some thought, and you manage to find a nougat of wisdom buried in there somewhere, that benefits you.

The world is in turmoil right now under the direction of the insiders. There will be massive transfers of wealth, market collapses, food shortages and much more over the coming months/years. The world will be a very different place going forward.

1610501785_12BSeHrHaz9gyid4AFkYdFYRcmFsS.body: Maybe it has something to do with the level of retarded posts? Nofish not increasing data limits may also be a factor? Once people hit the limit they are done and move on killing any chance of meaningful engagement. Sure they can delet older posts or create a new account but who is going to bother with that nonsense.

Unfortunately global search as in an indexed  search engine isn't an option which sucks big time. There are a few directory sites but most are poorly maintained, if they are maintained at all. None worthy of note spring to mind right now.  No doubt someone will post a link for you shortly. 

The best approach would be to create your own content and encourage people to visit your zite.

You will find ZeroNet is somewhat limited by comparison to the clearnet, but it does have it's strengths which the clearnet cant offer. At the very least it offers a relatively robust fallback position for when the shtf.

3) ZeroNet is a great platform to archive content which will potentially be memory holed on the clear net.

ZN could function reasonably well as a reddit alternative, although scaling would probably be the biggest issue if it attracted significant numbers of users. 

GAB can be a bit patchy at peek times for sure. As you say the GAB team are doing a great job under the circumstances.

1610527542_1NmKMF3LcKAxo5mCnGY1pctz343nW.body:
> [quantumkitty](#comment_534_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): It should go without saying.. we don't live in the 20th century anymore.

Wow, in that other thread you were implying that you are some sort of well educated intellectual genius or some shit, while everything you post seems to suggest that's not in fact the case. Iirc you were ridiculing New Zealanders in that thread also. 

Maybe English isn't your first language? In which case you maybe excused for making such a retarded comment, due to your failure to read and comprehend that which you mistakenly deride..."The 20th Century gave us the right-wing totalitarianism..." Here's a clue 'gave' sets the past tense of that sentence. Further contextual and tense clues can be found here  "But the 21st Century has given us a new, centrist form of totalitarianism..." Pay attention to the use of 'has' 'given' and 'new' all of which help the reader establish the correct tense being conveyed in the overall text.

Clearly the opening sets the narrative of past events which occurred in the 20th century, while the later brings us to the present in the 21st century. Nowhere does the text suggest the reader should assume the 20th century is the present.

> [qzm](#comment_10_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3Y6ufX): At this point I am as prepared as I possibly can be given everything that is going on. Mainly, I’m just concerned about all these conservative right wing types that think that they are somehow going to avert what is coming. The fact is that the great reset is set in stone at this point, and it’s totally irreversible. I liken it to a more technocratic version of what the Soviets did in Russia, it came, it destroyed, eventually it fizzled out. But these cycles are inevitable. The Trump crowd, and the Q people Thought that they could throw a wrench in it and maybe stop it, but that’s clearly unrealistic given the sheer amount of money and control behind it.People need to stop thinking that they are going to revolt, or the that is even a possibility. Rather, they should be thinking about how they’re going to survive the next 20 years at least. As sad as it is most reasonable, brave, individualistic people are going to be either snuffed out or else ideologically broken within the next couple of decades in America. Moreover, the plan should be to survive, escape if possible, and do not be fooled into believing you can revolt.

Nothing is set in stone unless you're a powerless defeatist. If the technology we have today existed seventy years ago  the soviet state would have used it to create the technocratic form of communism we see manifesting today. Not sure what gives you the impression it fizzled out? It hasn't fizzled out it has evolved. No the cycles aren't inevitable they are engineered - it's by design.

I don't trust Trump or anyone else in positions of power and influence. Having said that it is a matter of record that Trump signed executive orders which facilitate the reformation of the Republic as it was intended. Those EO's empower the people if they understand how to use them. He also established EO's which allow the seizure of assets from individuals and corporations engaged in crimes of sedition and treason against America. They have all the evidence they need against all the players involved, both domestic and foreign. Money isn't the issue when the money was obtained and used in criminal activity. The wealth was originally stolen from the people, regardless of their political leaning. 

Who are you to tell people that they should stop thinking of revolt? Just because you're a snivelling coward doesn't mean everyone else should be cowardly rats. If you think revolt isn't even possible then you clearly have zero knowledge of history. Revolt can take many forms and generally governments are the ones who resort to violence first, not the people. The American constitution and lawful process gives the people the means to revolt peacefully. The problem is the criminals do not respect the constitution or due process of law. And they will use violence to prevent the people from using peaceful means of change, once the people have exhausted all lawful avenues.

You should study the soviet system in order to understand that surviving under tyranny isn't a sustainable or healthy way to live. We all have a choice whether or not to aspire to living a meaningful life or a life of meaningless conformity and submission. Out of eighty million American Trump supporters there will be a significant number which will not bend the knee. They are the people who understand what is at stake for the future of their families and neighbors. They are the ones who understand that self preservation isn't the answer to the problem. That's why those people become the primary target of an oppressive tyrannical regime, as they present a real threat to the system. The rats and cowards are passive and weak, which means they can be eliminated over time with little or  no resistance. In this technocratic age there will be nowhere for self preserving cowards to hide from what's planned for them. Do you really expect a tyrannical regime to respect low life scum who aren't even willing to stand and defend themselves? Look at history!

You are only fooling yourself if you think hiding and capitulating is a viable long term survival stratify. Not only will the system hate you, your family and neighbours will despise you. Worst of all you will despise yourself!

Talk to folk from the old soviet countries, and see what they have to say about living under those conditions, and how it effects the lives of families and communities.

If you want to live and die on your knees that's your choice. Quite frankly you're not the type strong communities need in order to prosper and thrive. I hear they have some nice new vaccines for your type.

Here's an ex-KGB defector explaining how things work under communism https://www.bitchute.com/video/MPPq2RvF0bkw/

> [quantumkitty](#comment_3_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): Well, a lot of the times it's just basic common sense. [...]

Common sense? That analogy doesn't make sense, unless everyone involved in car accidents is insignificant and represents no threat to any other interested party. There are plenty of examples which demonstrate that death resulting from car accidents have been instigated by governments or third-parties. Dianna Spencer and Dodi Al-fayed would be but one of many examples, which contradict your analogy. 

If you're applying your analogy simply to yourself it may hold water - assuming that you're insignificant and present no risk.

> @grouch0 "I don't follow any leaders and I sure as hell don't buy into false dialectics such as a false two party system."
> 
> Sure you follow leaders.Everybody does. At least you follow the rules these leaders make.Otherwise you were in jail right now.
>

That's a presumption on your part as you have no idea what I do or do not comply with. You would need to be caught and convicted of a crime in order to be in jail. You can challenge rules based on lawful/legal arguments, at least that's the case where I reside. It maybe different for folk who do not live in a common law jurisdiction.  
 
> "I prefer the Socratic method to weed out the bullshit/fact from fiction."
> There is no time for this really, really ineffective method. You have to make decisions right now. Only time can tell if your decision was right or wrong.
> 

What do you mean there is no time for this really? If you don't have time then you're reacting not thinking. With respect to the matter at hand there has been more than enough time for most people to research and think things through!

Do you understand the Socratic method? Have you ever studied the Trivium method (I mean the real classic Trivium, not some bastardised variant)?

> "I'm not trying to tell you or anyone else not to take it."
> Why are you even here? Of course you are trying to influence people in a certain direction.
> 

I'm here to share ideas and information. If something I say or information I present influences another then that is okay by me, it's not my express purpose however. Therefore I disagree with your premise. I'm interested in encouraging people to think for themselves, and I'm interested in the views of people who think for themselves. My reason for being here is to keep an eye on ZeroNet's development as a viable alternative platform.  

> To make it clear:
> I would choose leader #2. Because I would rather die or see many people die than I have to live a life like that.
> And I forgot to say that leader #2 would also not force you to take any vaccine against your will.
> 

Just because you would choose a leader doesn't mean everyone else has to make a choice, when neither aligns with their perspective. Of course you chose option two, because you created a character that conformed to your world view, to serves a purpose. My choice was not to be manipulated, by not play your game.

> And yes, personally I'm trying to tell people not to tell the vaccine, because of many reasons:
> -Big pharma should not get more money
> -Big pharma should not make the people more dependent on their medicine
> -I think that the vaccine does not do what everybody claims
> -It might be harmful
> -I don't trust big pharma
> -People with a weak immune system should simply die if there is no other solution than taking away all rights from 99% of population

There's the fundamental difference between us! While I agree with you with respect to the dangers, and I can support my position with information and arguments, I don't wish to impose my views upon others.
